data.text:
Billy Joel’s song Only The Good Die Young is an amazing track to listen to. But in reality, the words of that line are haunting.

Death is inevitable, we have been told that time and again. But when a life is lost, the universal truth of death does not provide much solace.

Here are 7 famous Indian Celebrities, who died an unexpected death.

1. Ishmeet Singh (2 September, 1988 – 29 July, 2008)

Ishmeet won the Star Plus show Amul STAR Voice of India in 2007 and also participated in another reality show called Jo Jeeta Wohi Superstar. His first album was a religious Gurbani album called Satgur Tumre Kaaj Savaare. He died by suspected drowning in Maldives on 29 July, 2008.

2. Taruni Suchdev (14 May, 1998 – 14 May, 2012)

Taruni, better known as the “Rasna Girl”, was an Indian model and child actress known for her work in television advertisements and flims. She was one of the busiest child models in the industry. She has acted beside Amitabh Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and Vidya Balan in the Hindi film Paa in 2009. She also starred in two Malayalam films and was the highest paid child artist of her time. She also acted in a Tamil serial and the famous Hindi serial Sasural Simar Ka.

Taruni died in the Agni Air Flight CHT plane crash in Nepal on 14 May, 2012. Before she left for the Nepal trip, she hugged all her friends and said, “I’m meeting you guys for the last time.” Though it was a light-hearted joke but according to her classmates she had never hugged her friends or sent them goodbye messages before leaving for any of her earlier trips. The last message Taruni sent before boarding the flight was to her best friend where she jokingly asked what would happen if the plane crashed followed by “I love you.” Her friends believe that it was written in her destiny to die on that plane.

3. Jiah Khan (born Nafisa Rizvi Khan) (20 February, 1988 – 3 June 2013)

Jiah was a British-American actress and singer who appeared in Bollywood films from 2007-2010. She made her film debut in Ram Gopal Verma’s Nishabd in 2007, later portrayed a modern independent woman in Ghajini in 2008 and her final film appearance was in Sajid Khan’s romantic comedy Housefull in 2010. She had captured herself into the Bollywood 100 Crore Club with Ghajini and Housefull.

On June 3, 2013 she was found hanging from the ceiling fan of her bedroom of her family’s residence in Juhu. Sooraj Pancholi, who was allegedly in a live-in relationship with Jiah, was suspected for her murder. But on 1 August, 2016 CBI ruled out the murder case. But later a British forensics expert concluded that Jiah’s hanging was staged and the marks on her face and neck indicated that it was not a simple suicide.

4. Sandeep Acharya (4 February, 1984 – 15 December, 2013)

Sandeep got his fame after winning the second season of the popular reality television show Indian Idol in 2006. He also made an appearance in the romantic drama series Kaisa Ye Pyar Hai on Sony TV. Acharya died of Jaundice on 15 December, 2013.

5. Pratyusha Banerjee (10 August, 1991 – 1 April, 2016)

Pratyusha was an Indian television actress and appeared in numerous television and reality shows. She gained her initial recognition from her first lead role as “Anandi” in the famous daily soap Balika Vadhu in 2010. She had also participated in the famous controversial reality show Big Boss 7 in 2013. She had also participated in Jhalak Dikhla Jaa (season 5) and played important roles in Hum Hain Na, Sasural Simar Ka and Gulmohar Grand.

She was found hanging in her Mumbai apartment on 1 April, 2016. The reason behind her suicide is believed to be her complicated relationship with boyfriend Rahul Raj.

6. Reema Lagoo (21 June, 1958 – 18 May, 2017)

Reema was an Indian theater and screen actress known for her work in Hindi and Marathi cinema. She started her career on Marathi stage. She was the epitome of motherhood in Bollywood films. She shot to fame in the 80s hit Maine Pyar Kiya. She has also starred in some of the biggest hits of Bollywood including Hum Saath Saath Hai, Hum Aapke Hain Kaun, Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, Kal Ho Na Ho, etc. She was also casted in the daily soap Tu Tu Main Main on Star Plus.

Lagoo died of cardiac arrest on 18 May, 2017. She was described as “perfectly fine” and having “no health issues” at the time of her death.

7. Sridevi (born Shree Amma Yanger Ayyapan) (13 August, 1963 – 24 Feb 2018)

Sridevi was an Indian actress and film producer who starred in Tamil, Telugu, Hindi, Malayalam and Kannada films. She was ranked among the highest-paid actors in 1980s and 1990s and is considered as Bollywood’s “first female superstar”. She made her first debut at the age of 4 and started her acting career in lead role as a child. She made her Hindi film debut as a child artist in 1972 and played her first adult role in a Tamil film at the age of 13. Sridevi established herself as one of the leading actresses of Tamil and Telugu cinema. Her first starring role in Hindi cinema was in 1979 but her role besides Jeetendra in Himmatwala (1983) helped her gain wide recognition.

Sridevi was awarded the Padma Shri for her contributions to the entertainment industry in 2013 by the Government of India. State governments of Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala conferred Honourary awards on her. She was also voted “India’s Greatest Actresses in 100 Years” in a CNN-IBN national poll conducted on the occation of the century on the Indian Cinema in 2013. She was married to the film producer Boney Kapoor in 1996 and had two daughters Jhanvi and Khushi.

Sridevi was found dead on 24 February, 2018 in her hotel room in Dubai. Although, earlier it was announced that the cause of death was a cardiac arrest, the forensic report released by Dubai Police indicated that she died of accidental drowning in the bathtub of the hotel room.

~Priyal Murdia
